snippet: Lawmakers passed a bill requiring the Defense and Veterans Affairs Departments to begin a study within a month to assess how combat, not just deployment, affects mental health.
abstract: Congress passes bill that requires Veterans Affairs and Defense Depts to study long-term mental health effects of combat; bill is primarily motivated by issue of suicides among veterans.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers passed a bill requiring the Defense and Veterans Affairs Departments to begin a study within a month to assess how combat, not just deployment, affects mental health.

headline.main: Congress Orders Defense Dept. to Study Combat’s Effects on Veteran Suicide Rates
headline.print_headline: Congress Orders Defense Dept. to Study Combat’s Effects on Veteran Suicide Rates

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
